Title: Protecting half of the planet could directly affect over one billion people
Abstract: © 2019, The Author(s), under exclusive licence to Springer Nature Limited.In light of continuing global biodiversity loss, one ambitious proposal has gained considerable traction amongst conservationists: the goal to protect half the Earth. Our analysis suggests that at least one billion people live in places that would be protected if the Half Earth proposal were implemented within all ecoregions. Taking into account the social and economic impacts of such proposals is central to addressing social and environmental justice concerns, and assessing their acceptability and feasibility.
SubjectAreas: Renewable Energy, Sustainability and the Environment
